009package Ch14_Colorimetric_Color;
010
011import ij.ImagePlus;
012import ij.gui.NewImage;
013import ij.plugin.filter.PlugInFilter;
014import ij.process.ColorProcessor;
015import ij.process.ImageProcessor;
016import imagingbook.common.color.RgbUtils;
017import imagingbook.common.color.cie.CieUtils;
018import imagingbook.common.color.cie.CieXyPlot;
019import imagingbook.common.color.colorspace.sRGB65ColorSpace;
020import imagingbook.common.ij.DialogUtils;
021import imagingbook.common.ij.overlay.ColoredStroke;
022import imagingbook.common.ij.overlay.ShapeOverlayAdapter;
023import imagingbook.core.jdoc.JavaDocHelp;
024import imagingbook.sampleimages.GeneralSampleImage;
025
026import java.awt.Color;
027import java.awt.Shape;
028import java.awt.color.ColorSpace;
029
030import static imagingbook.common.ij.IjUtils.noCurrentImage;
031
032/**
033 * ImageJ plugin, takes any RGB color image and plots its color distribution in CIE xy-space, together with the
034 * outline of the xy ("horseshoe") chromaticity outline.
035 */
036public class Plot_Chromaticity_Chart implements PlugInFilter, JavaDocHelp {
037
038    private static int ImageSize = 512;
039
040    /**
041     * Constructor, asks to open a predefined sample image if no other image is currently open.
042     */
043    public Plot_Chromaticity_Chart() {
044        if (noCurrentImage()) {
045            DialogUtils.askForSampleImage(GeneralSampleImage.Flower);
046        }
047    }
048
049    @Override
050    public int setup(String arg, ImagePlus imp) {
051        return DOES_RGB + NO_CHANGES;
052    }
053
054    @Override
055    public void run(ImageProcessor ip) {
056        ColorProcessor cp = (ColorProcessor) ip;
057        ImagePlus imPlot =
058                NewImage.createRGBImage("Cie Chromaticity (xy)", ImageSize, ImageSize, 1, NewImage.FILL_WHITE);
059        ColorProcessor cpPlot = (ColorProcessor) imPlot.getProcessor();
060        cpPlot.setColor(Color.lightGray);
061        cpPlot.fill();
062
063        ColorSpace cs = sRgbColorSpace.getInstance();
064
065        int[] pixels = (int[]) cp.getPixels();
066
067        int[] RGB = new int[3];
068        for (int i = 0; i < pixels.length; i++) {
069            int p = pixels[i];
070            // from RGB, calculate XYZ and xy:
071            RgbUtils.decodeIntToRgb(p, RGB);
072            float[] srgb = RgbUtils.normalize(RGB);
073            float[] XYZ = cs.toCIEXYZ(srgb);
074            float[] xy = CieUtils.XYZToxy(XYZ);
075            int xx = (int) Math.round(xy[0] * ImageSize);
076            int yy = (int) Math.round((1 - xy[1]) * ImageSize);
077
078            // place a brighness-normalized image pixel at the (xy) position:
079            float[] XYZn = CieUtils.xyToXYZ(xy[0], xy[1]);
080            float[] srgbn = cs.fromCIEXYZ(XYZn);
081            int[] RGBn = RgbUtils.denormalize(srgbn);
082            cpPlot.putPixel(xx, yy, RGBn);
083        }
084
085        ShapeOverlayAdapter ola = new ShapeOverlayAdapter();
086        Shape xyPlot = new CieXyPlot(ImageSize);
087        ola.addShape(xyPlot, new ColoredStroke(0.35, Color.blue));
088
089        imPlot.setOverlay(ola.getOverlay());
090        imPlot.show();
091    }
092}
